text:
Apache 2.2.0 will not deliver a html document when the document is formatted as
attached.  The access log shows the request.  However, all browsers with which I
attempt to request the file simply await for a response that doesn't occur. 
There is nothing in the error log.  

The location and name of the file matter, only the content.  As far as I can
tell, if you remove even a single letter from the file, then Apache serves the
file just fine.  

I've tried the same file on Apache 1.3.27 and 2.0.54 and the file is always
served correctly.  However, I only have access to one machine with 2.2.0 so I
can't be sure it's not a local problem.  

# /usr/sbin/httpd -v
Server version: Apache/2.2.0
Server built:   Feb 11 2006 18:10:38

# uname -a
Linux wifflechumpsjr 2.6.16-1.2107_FC5 #1 Tue May 2 19:01:05 EDT 2006 i686 i686
i386 GNU/Linux
creator: mike@hoolehan.com

text: I meant to say the location and name of the files does _not_ matter.
creator: mike@hoolehan.com

text: Booted with an older kernel, all symptoms disappeared.  Resolving INVALID.  Thanks.
